structure.unit: Motorboats, Other Vessels And Recreational Vehicles

text.section: A motorboat owned in a country other than the United States temporarily using the waters of the commonwealth.
A motorboat owned by an agency of the United States government or by a state, county, city or town.

A motorboat numbered in accordance with a numbering system established by the secretary; provided, that the certificate of number or similar document awarding a number to such motorboat is in full force and effect; and provided, further, that such motorboat shall not have been within the commonwealth for a period of time in excess of sixty consecutive days.

A motorboat numbered in accordance with the numbering system of another state, which system has been approved by the secretary; provided, that the certificate of number or similar document awarding a number to such motorboat is in full force and effect; and provided, further, that such motorboat shall not have been within the commonwealth for a period of time in excess of sixty consecutive days.
A vessel which has a valid marine document issued by the Bureau of Customs of the United States government or any federal agency successor thereto.
